title: Tech - South China Morning Post
description: The latest technology news, reviews, gadgets, launches and products.

items.title: Nvidia, Tesla chase same self-driving goal via different paths
items.creator: Bloomberg
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Nvidia, Tesla chase same self-driving goal via different paths

images.alt: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says that while getting an autonomous driving system to work most of the time was relatively easy, solving rare and unpredictable edge cases was far harder. Photo: Getty Images/TNS
images.title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says that while getting an autonomous driving system to work most of the time was relatively easy, solving rare and unpredictable edge cases was far harder. Photo: Getty Images/TNS

items.content:
Jensen Huang took the stage at the CES trade show in Las Vegas this week to make the clearest pitch yet for Nvidia’s autonomous driving technology. In doing so, the CEO’s vision for vehicles that can drive themselves edged into the terrain of major customers like Tesla and its boss, Elon Musk.
Huang’s remarks sparked a widely watched – if notably polite – indirect multiday exchange between two of the most influential figures in technology. It also sharpened a central question about autonomous...

items.title: Elon Musk to open source X algorithm in 7 days amid global scrutiny
items.creator: Bloomberg
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Elon Musk to open source X algorithm in 7 days amid global scrutiny

images.alt: Elon Musk is the founder of xAI, which has developed the Grok chatbot. Photo: AFP
images.title: Elon Musk is the founder of xAI, which has developed the Grok chatbot. Photo: AFP

items.content:
Social media platform X will open its new algorithm to the public in seven days, Elon Musk said on Saturday, including the code used to decide what posts and advertisements are recommended to users.
“This will be repeated every 4 weeks, with comprehensive developer notes, to help you understand what changed,” Musk, who owns X, said in a post on the platform.
The billionaire did not say why X was making its algorithm open source. He and the company have clashed several times with regulators over...

items.title: How the AI race could play out for the US, China and the world
items.creator: Mark Purdy
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: How the AI race could play out for the US, China and the world
items.content:
The global artificial intelligence (AI) race remains one of the most hotly contested spheres of international competition. Few would bet today on an eventual winner, but current trends point to three possible scenarios that we should consider.
In the first scenario, the AI world is dominated by the US and China. While the US still has the technological edge, China is closing in fast and vies with the US for leadership on many of the key dimensions of AI prowess.
According to Stanford...

items.title: Chinese smart eyewear makers shine at CES with focus on challenging Meta

items.translated_title: Chinese smart eyewear makers shine at CES with focus on challenging Meta

images.alt: LLVision’s Leion Hey2 augmented reality translation smart glasses on display at the CES trade show. Photo: Wency Chen
images.title: LLVision’s Leion Hey2 augmented reality translation smart glasses on display at the CES trade show. Photo: Wency Chen

items.content:
Dozens of Chinese makers of smart glasses dazzled the exhibition floor at the recent CES trade show in Las Vegas, where they showed lightweight, artificial intelligence-powered eyewear aimed at a category that has been largely defined by Meta Platforms’ Ray-Ban Display.
At the four-day annual trade show, which concluded on Friday, Chinese brands made up most of the roughly 60 smart eyewear exhibitors. Their products ranged from audio-first frames designed for all-day wear to augmented reality...

items.title: Review of Meta-Manus deal underlines China’s tightening grip on AI exports
items.creator: Ben Jiang,Coco Feng
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Review of Meta-Manus deal underlines China’s tightening grip on AI exports
items.content:
China’s review of Meta Platforms’ acquisition of artificial intelligence agent start-up Manus signals Beijing’s intent to more tightly police foreign involvement in sensitive technologies developed by Chinese entrepreneurs, as more founders move operations overseas to sidestep geopolitical scrutiny, analysts say.
The Ministry of Commerce said on Thursday that it would work with other Chinese regulators to assess whether the acquisition complied with the country’s export controls and technology...

items.title: The great chip leap: China’s semiconductor equipment self-reliance surges past targets
items.creator: Eunice Xu
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: The great chip leap: China’s semiconductor equipment self-reliance surges past targets

images.alt: China is projected to maintain its position as the world’s largest market for semiconductor equipment through 2027. Photo: Shutterstock
images.title: China is projected to maintain its position as the world’s largest market for semiconductor equipment through 2027. Photo: Shutterstock

items.content:
China’s drive for chip manufacturing equipment self-sufficiency advanced so rapidly in 2025 that even the country’s planners were caught by surprise, as the ratio of domestically developed semiconductor equipment surged to 35 per cent by the year’s end, up from 25 per cent in 2024.
The ratio was higher than Beijing’s target of 30 per cent, set in early 2025 to encourage China’s semiconductor industry to favour local suppliers over US rivals such as Applied Materials, Lam Research and KLA,...

items.title: Chinese firms outpace US rivals in 2025 humanoid robot shipments, as AgiBot takes lead
items.creator: Iris Deng
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Chinese firms outpace US rivals in 2025 humanoid robot shipments, as AgiBot takes lead
items.content:
Shanghai-based AgiBot topped global humanoid robot shipments in 2025, with nearly a 38 per cent share, as China’s robotics firms dominated the market, leaving in the dust major US players like Elon Musk’s Tesla.
According to data released on Thursday by Omdia, AgiBot shipped 5,168 humanoid robots last year to lead five other Chinese companies in the research firm’s top 10 list.
Unitree Robotics, headquartered in Hangzhou, ranked second with 4,200 humanoids shipped last year, which accounted for...

items.title: Alibaba logistics unit Cainiao opens US-Mexico cross-border service
items.creator: Ann Cao
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Alibaba logistics unit Cainiao opens US-Mexico cross-border service

images.alt: Trucks queue near the US-Mexico border before proceeding to the Otay Commercial crossing in Tijuana, a city in the Mexican state of Baja California, on March 4, 2025. Photo: AFP
images.title: Trucks queue near the US-Mexico border before proceeding to the Otay Commercial crossing in Tijuana, a city in the Mexican state of Baja California, on March 4, 2025. Photo: AFP

items.content:
Cainiao, the logistics arm of Alibaba Group Holding, is stepping up its overseas push with a new service crossing the US-Mexico border.
The cross-border logistics service, a first for Cainiao in the Americas, was designed to handle parcel flow between the two countries, which was one of the region’s high-traffic corridors, the Alibaba unit said on Friday. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.
The service was expected to reach 99 per cent of the Mexico market and would be priced at around 60...

items.title: MiniMax and Zhipu’s stellar Hong Kong IPOs supercharge China’s AI ambitions

items.translated_title: MiniMax and Zhipu’s stellar Hong Kong IPOs supercharge China’s AI ambitions

images.alt: The Zhipu logo is displayed on a smartphone with the homepage in the background. Photo: CFOTO/Future Publishing via Getty Images
images.title: The Zhipu logo is displayed on a smartphone with the homepage in the background. Photo: CFOTO/Future Publishing via Getty Images

items.content:
The red-hot Hong Kong initial public offerings (IPOs) of Zhipu AI and MiniMax Group, two of China’s hopefuls to take on US giants like OpenAI and Anthropic, have given a boost to Beijing’s ambitions in the artificial intelligence sector, according to executives and industry watchers.
While Zhipu’s valuation of about US$9 billion and MiniMax’s market cap of US$14 billion remain tiny compared with the US giants – OpenAI is worth about US$500 billion and Anthropic’s valuation is estimated at about...

items.title: Chinese AI start-up MiniMax shines on Hong Kong IPO debut
items.creator: Aileen Chuang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Chinese AI start-up MiniMax shines on Hong Kong IPO debut

images.alt: MiniMax executives and Hong Kong government officials at the company’s trading debut on the Hong Kong stock exchange on Friday. Photo: Aileen Chuang
images.title: MiniMax executives and Hong Kong government officials at the company’s trading debut on the Hong Kong stock exchange on Friday. Photo: Aileen Chuang

items.content:
Shares of Chinese artificial intelligence start-up MiniMax Group surged on their Hong Kong debut on Friday, reflecting investor confidence after securing substantial support from global institutional backers.
The company’s shares first changed hands at HK$235.40, up 42.7 per cent from the initial public offering (IPO) price of HK$165. The stock surged as much as 113.2 per cent to HK$351.80 before ending the day 109.1 per cent higher at HK$345, valuing it at HK$106.7 billion (US$13.7...

items.title: Chinese robot vacuum maker Dreame bets on AI-driven appliances to run household chores

items.translated_title: Chinese robot vacuum maker Dreame bets on AI-driven appliances to run household chores

images.alt: Dreame displays its ultra-compact Leaptic action cameras at the CES trade show. Photo: Wency Chen
images.title: Dreame displays its ultra-compact Leaptic action cameras at the CES trade show. Photo: Wency Chen

items.content:
Chinese household appliances maker Dreame Technology unveiled more than 20 new artificial intelligence-embedded products at this year’s CES trade show in Las Vegas, showing a glimpse of the future when smart devices would run almost all chores in a house.
Those formed part of more than 150 products that Dreame, one of the world’s top five vendors of robot vacuum cleaners, exhibited at the four-day trade show that concludes this Friday.
Dreame’s new “AI-powered whole-home smart ecosystem”...

items.title: China’s Xpeng unveils hybrid SUV version boasting world’s longest driving distance
items.creator: Coco Feng
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s Xpeng unveils hybrid SUV version boasting world’s longest driving distance

images.alt: Xpeng’s sales volume ranked eighth globally among new energy marques in the first 10 months of 2025, says CEO He Xiaopeng. Photo: Handout
images.title: Xpeng’s sales volume ranked eighth globally among new energy marques in the first 10 months of 2025, says CEO He Xiaopeng. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Chinese electric vehicle (EV) giant Xpeng Motors has launched a new hybrid version of its G7 that it says offers the world’s longest range among SUVs, capable of covering the distance from Seattle to Los Angeles without charging.
The updated G7 could travel 1,704km – longer than the distance between Beijing and Shanghai – with a 60-litre fuel tank and a 55.8kWh pack, the company said at a launch event in Guangzhou on Thursday.
The model combines batteries with a small petrol engine that...

items.translated_title: Shanghai steps up oversight of delayed payment practices hurting suppliers

images.alt: Powerful manufacturers like electric vehicle assemblers often delay payments to suppliers of auto parts to free up cash for price wars. Photo: AFP
images.title: Powerful manufacturers like electric vehicle assemblers often delay payments to suppliers of auto parts to free up cash for price wars. Photo: AFP

items.content:
Shanghai, mainland China’s commercial and financial hub, has pledged to step up policing its manufacturing sectors to curb prolonged payment cycles that affect thousands of supply-chain vendors.
Gu Jun, deputy secretary general of the municipal government and director of the city’s development and reform commission, told a press conference on Thursday that a task force had been set up to ensure money owed to vendors would be paid promptly.
“Supervision will be strengthened to avoid delayed...

items.translated_title: Core Chinese research team behind cutting-edge AI model R1 remains intact: DeepSeek
items.content:
Chinese artificial intelligence firm DeepSeek has updated the technical paper of its landmark R1 model, showcasing the contributions of the 18 core scientists who powered its AI ambitions and capabilities, as anticipation heightened about a potential new major model release.
The paper suggested that DeepSeek retained all 18 scientists behind its AI model development efforts, as well as many of the R1 project’s 176 contributors, despite fierce competition for talent in China’s AI industry.
The...

items.translated_title: Tech war: China semiconductor expert suggests vigilance in buying Nvidia’s H200 AI chips

images.alt: Wei Shaojun, vice-president of the China Semiconductor Industry Association. Photo: Sina
images.title: Wei Shaojun, vice-president of the China Semiconductor Industry Association. Photo: Sina

items.content:
Influential Chinese semiconductor expert Wei Shaojun urged caution for mainland companies that place orders for Nvidia’s H200 artificial intelligence chips, as it remained a puzzle why the US government would make these advanced integrated circuits available to the country.
“The US’ inconsistent stance on advanced chips – alternating between limited easing and renewed pressure – has left users struggling to discern its true strategic intent,” Wei, vice-president at the China Semiconductor...

items.title: China to probe Meta’s purchase of Manus over export controls, tech outflow concerns

items.translated_title: China to probe Meta’s purchase of Manus over export controls, tech outflow concerns

images.alt: Meta Platforms acquired Manus, which developed its AI products in China, for US$2.5 billion. Photo: Reuters
images.title: Meta Platforms acquired Manus, which developed its AI products in China, for US$2.5 billion. Photo: Reuters

items.content:
China’s Ministry of Commerce says it will conduct a review and investigation into Meta Platforms’ US$2.5 billion acquisition of Manus, examining whether the deal complies with export controls and technology transfer rules, underscoring Beijing’s determination to assert oversight over cross-border technology transactions.
Spokesperson He Yadong said at a briefing on Thursday that the ministry would work with other Chinese regulators to assess whether the deal, announced by Meta and Manus a week...

items.title: Dose of uncertainty: experts wary of AI health tech gadgets on display at CES trade show
items.creator: Associated Press
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Dose of uncertainty: experts wary of AI health tech gadgets on display at CES trade show
items.content:
Health tech gadgets displayed at the annual CES trade show make a lot of promises. A smart scale promoted a healthier lifestyle by scanning your feet to track your heart health, and an egg-shaped hormone tracker uses artificial intelligence to help you figure out the best time to conceive.
Technology and health experts, however, question the accuracy of products like these and warn of data privacy issues – especially as the US federal government eases up on regulation.
The US Food and Drug...

items.translated_title: Lenovo unveils new AI agent, Nvidia tie-up in glitzy show at CES 2026

images.alt: Lenovo’s Yang Yuanqing and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on stage at the massive Las Vegas Sphere, announcing a new joint project. Photo: Xinmei Shen
images.title: Lenovo’s Yang Yuanqing and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on stage at the massive Las Vegas Sphere, announcing a new joint project. Photo: Xinmei Shen

items.content:
Personal computer giant Lenovo Group has unveiled a new personal AI agent and a host of enterprise artificial intelligence initiatives at CES this year, in a splashy display of its AI ambitions.
Lenovo on Tuesday announced Qira, a “personal AI super agent” designed to work across multiple devices including Lenovo laptops, tablets and Motorola smartphones.
Qira can summarise notifications, offer real-time transcriptions and translations, and coordinate other AI agents for tasks such as travel...

items.title: 3 Chinese tech stocks gain in Hong Kong debuts as investors jump on AI, robotics
items.creator: Aileen Chuang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: 3 Chinese tech stocks gain in Hong Kong debuts as investors jump on AI, robotics
items.content:
Chinese start-up Zhipu AI headlined a trio of technology new listings in Hong Kong on Thursday, in a key test of investor confidence in China’s AI industry as it goes head to head with US giants.
Shares of the Beijing-based company rose 3.3 per cent to HK$120 at the open from the initial public offering (IPO) price of HK$116.20. The stock later rose as much as 16.2 per cent before ending the day 13.2 per cent higher at HK$131.50, valuing the company at HK$57.89 billion (US$7.43 billion). Zhipu...

items.title: DeepSeek to customise namesake chatbot for Italian users following probe

items.translated_title: DeepSeek to customise namesake chatbot for Italian users following probe
items.content:
Chinese artificial intelligence firm DeepSeek has agreed to launch the first country-specific version of its namesake chatbot, while tackling the problem of “hallucinations” in its AI models to meet the requirements of regulators in Italy.
DeepSeek assented to the package of commitments after a months-long negotiation with the Italian Competition Authority, known as the AGCM, which had earlier accused the Hangzhou-based start-up of not sufficiently warning users in the country about the risk of...
